summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from September-October 2021 regarding a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) for all FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) email communications with victims and their attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell case. The emails discuss technical difficulties accessing and exporting the relevant email folder and the process for identifying which Victim Specialists (VS) assisted which victims.

persons.name: SA M
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who needs access to documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, along with VS.

events.title: Internal FBI discussion on victim communication compilation
events.description: FBI personnel discuss how to compile a list of victims and their assisting Victim Specialists, and gather all email communications with victims and their attorneys for the USAO, related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Request to export Epstein email folder
events.description: An email requests the export of the 'Epstein folder' from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox to provide all email communication with victims to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Technical issues accessing documents
events.description: Multiple FBI employees report technical difficulties accessing a shared document site or opening a PDF related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, requiring permission or alternative software.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) requested all FBI Victim Services Division email communications with victims and their attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
FBI internal discussions focused on how to identify which Victim Specialists (VS) assisted which victims, as VNS notification letters were sent directly to victims' attorneys and not all victims.
The FBI maintained a dedicated 'Epstein folder' in the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox containing victim and attorney communications.
There were ongoing technical access issues within the FBI regarding shared case documents in September-October 2021.
